RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui mestrado em Fsica - Sapienza Universit di Roma (1994), mestrado em Sacra Teologia pela Pontifcia Universidade Lateranense (1998) e posgrado pelo Ateneo Pontificio Regina Apostolorum (2012), doutorado em Astrofsica Relativstica - Universit de Nice Sophia Antipolis (2011) e doutorado em Fsica Terica - Sapienza Universit di Roma (1998). Pesquisador visitante no Observatrio Nacional (Rio de Janeiro, 2012-3) - professor - Sapienza Universit di Roma, professor - ITIS Galileo Ferraris Roma e professor - Ateneo Pontificio Regina Apostolorum. Tem experincia na rea de Astronomia, com nfase em Astrometria Solar, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: astrometria solar, historia da astronomia, historia da cincia, astronomia e optica atmosfrica.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: master's at Fsica from Sapienza Universit di Roma (1994), master's at Sacra Teologia from Pontifcia Universidade Lateranense (1998) specialization from Pontificio Ateneo Regina Apostolorum (2012), doctorate at Astrofsica Relativstica from Universit de Nice Sophia Antipolis (2011) and doctorate at Fsica Terica from Sapienza Universit di Roma (1998). Visiting Researcher at Observatrio Nacional in Rio de Janeiro (2012-3). Has experience in Astronomy, acting on the following subjects: astrometria solar, historia da astronomia, historia da cincia, astronomia and optica atmosfrica.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A bright Nova in Centaurus was discovered on Dec 2, 2013 at magnitude V=5.5. Its luminosity reached mv=3.8 from Dec 5 to 7, becoming the brightest Nova of 2013 and of the last decades. On Dec 14 it brightened at mv=3.2. The observations of the author contributed to the compilation of the IAU Circular 9265 which announced the Nova as V1369 Cen and are here described. The first observations have been made with naked eye, and the use of same altitude calibration stars of similar color allowed an accuracy within 0.1 magnitudes. The method of selecting stars on the same almucantarat (altitude circle) even farther than 20 degrees, reduces the effects of differential atmospheric extinction. Its application is useful not only for bright Novae but also for luminous variable stars like the supergiant Betelgeuse and Antares and some bright Miras.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A bright Nova in Centaurus was discovered on Dec 2, 2013 at magnitude V=5.5. Its luminosity reached mv=3.8 from Dec 5 to 7, becoming the brightest Nova of 2013 and of the last decades. On Dec 14 it brightened at mv=3.2. The observations of the author contributed to the compilation of the IAU Circular 9265 which announced the Nova as V1369 Cen and are here described. The first observations have been made with naked eye, and the use of same altitude calibration stars of similar color allowed an accuracy within 0.1 magnitudes. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
La seconda parte della esperienza di Eratostene (~272-192 a.C.) fatta a Syene, famosa per la misura della circonferenza della Terra di 250.000 stadi, riguarda il diametro solare. Posidonio (135-51 a. C.) riporta infatti anche il suo metodo per la misura del diametro angolare del Sole. A Syene (l attuale Assuan) un palo verticale non getta ombra al mezzogiorno del solstizio d Estate in una regione ampia 300 stadi, il diametro angolare del Sole spazza perci una frazione pari a 300/250.000 di angolo giro. Rio de Janeiro si trova poco a Nord del tropico del Capricorno e due volte all'anno il Sole passa allo zenith. Il 9 dicembre 2013 ho ripreso nell'istante del passaggio allo zenith le ombre attorno ad un palo verticale nella rua Fonseca Teles, Bairro Imperial de So Cristovo. Ci sono tanti fili elettrici e strutture in cima al palo che danno ombre spurie, ma effettivamente il palo risulta illuminato lungo tutta la sua circonferenza e non getta ombre proprie. Il centro del Sole sta nello zenith e dai suoi bordi a 15' dallo zenith la luce riesce ad illuminare il palo da tutti i lati. Il video inizia nell'istante del passaggio allo zenith e dura solo 29 secondi; durante questo tempo il centro del Sole si sposta di 2 minuti d'arco. Il palo comincia a gettare ombre dopo 4 minuti dal passaggio allo zenith.
Il testo di riferimento Costantino Sigismondi (2007) http://arxiv.org/abs/1211.2727
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The second part of the experience of Eratostenes in Syene on the tropic of Cancer, presented by Posidonius, is the measure of the solar angular diameter. The observations recorded on December 9, 2013 in Rio de Janeiro show that a pole is without shadow during the zenital passage of the Sun, and it remains in this way up to 4 minutes before and later, in agreement with the angular solar diameter of 32 arcminutes. Rio de Janeiro lies near the tropic of Capricornus and has the Sun at zenith twice per year, on Dec 9 and Jan 1.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Gerbert's acoustical and astronomical tubes
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Gerbert's acoustical and astronomical tubes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Gerbert of Aurillac dealt with tubes in astronomy and in acoustics. The celestial sphere he described to Constantine of Fleury in 978 has tubes for the accurate pointing of the North pole and for the observation of solstices and equinoxes days. After in 980 he built an organ for the emperor Otto II and wrote a treatise on the tuning of its tubes, De Mensura Fistularum, based on the number 12 of Pithagorean and Apostolic memory.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Gerbert of Aurillac dealt with tubes in astronomy and in acoustics. The celestial sphere he described to Constantine of Fleury in 978 has tubes for the accurate pointing of the North pole and for the observation of solstices and equinoxes days. After in 980 he built an organ for the emperor Otto II and wrote a treatise on the tuning of its tubes, De Mensura Fistularum, based on the number 12 of Pithagorean and Apostolic memory.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The act of the symposium Gerbertus Magister et Pastor held in Rome on May 2, 2011 and dedicated to the studies and to the activities of Gerbert of Aurillac, scientist, astronomer and pope. Here are presented the papers of Flavio G. Nuvolone, Paolo Rossi on historical subjects: Gerbert and king Lotarius, and the relationships between Gerbert and the Empire, with the choice of the name Sylvester. Finally Maurizio Chirri presents a study on the sources of the Geometry written by Gerbert, which contains also some astronomical methods as usual in the treatises of that epoch.

Finally Maurizio Chirri presents a study on the sources of the Geometry written by Gerbert, which contains also some astronomical methods as usual in the treatises of that epoch.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Prefazione al terzo volume di GERBERTVS
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Foreword to the third volume of GERBERTVS

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The symposium dedicated to Gerbert on 12.52012 was held at the Vallicelliana Library, in the Borromini hall. The title was Gerberto and Borromini, in order to evidence the link between Gerbert (938 ca. - 1003) and the Ticinese architect who saved his tumb, during the restauration of the Cathedral of Rome St. John in Laterano in 1648. It is possibile that from his residence in the Lateran Gerbert could observe the stars with his tubes, which are presented by C. Sigismondi in this volume. During his trips to Italy, alone and following the archbishop Adalbero of Reims Gerbert could have passed in the Chiusa Valley and influence with his astronomical knowledges the builders of the Sacra of S. Michele, this is the subject of Laura C. Paladino study. Abbo of Fleury is contemporary to Gerbert and he had the same vast interests. He studied in England and they are presented together in the paper of Paolo Rossi. Veronica Regoli shows the link between Gerbert, Dante and Jerusalem.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Prefazione al quarto volume di GERBERTVS
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Foreword to the fourth volume of GERBERTVS

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The fourth volume of GERBERTVS contains the acts of the symposia held in Rome, at the Odeion hall of Lettere faculty in Sapienza University on December 7, 2012 Gerbert Homo Novus and on March 13, 2013 on the pre and post humanistic figures. Laura C. Paladino presents the didactical activity of Gerbert as from Richer of Reims who completed his Historia Francorum in 998, before the election of Gerbert to the pontifical soil. Among these activities there is the teaching of astronomy and mathematics and the abacus, to which a special article of Jorge Nuno Silva is dedicated. The abacus increased dramatically the rapidity of the computations and some algoritms thaught by Gerbert and reported by his former student Bernelinus is very reliably invented by Gerbert himself, as Silva demostrates in his paper. Giancarlo Pani presents the relation between Galileo and Kepler, at the end of the humanistic period, showing interesting insights on the rather asymmetrical exchange of information between the two greater astronomer of 1600. Veronica Regoli presents the Cosmos of Dante, the ideal structure of the Divine Comedy. Patrick Demouy presents the new biography of Flavio G. Nuvolone where the great novelty is the noble origin of Gerbert from Carlat family, but before the marriage of his (presumed) father. His birth is shifted back to 938 with technical demostrations. Paolo Zanna compares the magisterium of Gerbert-Sylvester II and that one of John Paul II and pope Francesco. Finally C. Sigismondi presents the work and the activities of Pawel Max Maksym (1983-2013) who founded the Observatory &"Pope Sylvester II" in the town of Bukowiec, near Lodz, Poland.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Pawel Max Maksym (1983-2013) Polish Astronomer and Film-maker
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Pawel Max Maksym (1983-2013) Polish Astronomer and Film-maker

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Occultation Astronomy

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The sudden and untimely death of Pawel Max Maksym will not diminish his contributions to the field of occultation astronomy, and to Polish society in general. Founder of the Pope Silvester II Observatory in Bukowiec, he was also writing a book to introduce children to astronomy. Graduating in Geography with an experimental thesis in Lunar Occultations at Lodz University, Pawel earned a diploma from the prestigious National Film School in Lodz. An expert observer, he mastered the technique of stellar occultations, fostering the scientific activity of the Observatory. A review of his publications in Minor Planet Circulars and on YouTube is presented here.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-LIVRO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: High precision ground-based measurements of solar diameter
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-LIVRO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: High precision ground-based measurements of solar diameter

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The measurement of the solar diameter is a topic more than 350 years old, started with the works of Cassini and Picard, but did not yet receive an adequate answer! It is important for studying solar variability and the influences upon the Earth's climate; ancient eclipses data and planetary transits extend the knowledge of the solar irradiance back to three centuries. In the last two transits of Venus the black-drop effect was overcomed, improving the accuracy. Spatially resolved photometry of Baily's beads during eclipses allows to scan the limb darkening function of the Sun to find its inflection point with an unprecedented accuracy of a few milliarcseconds, thanks to the new lunar valley's profiles of Kaguya lunar probe. Daily transits in drift-scan mode have been observed with solar astrolabes (Calern-Rio) meridian telescopes (Greenwich, Rome) and larger telescopes (Locarno, Paris) finding a 0.01 Hz seeing component affecting these measures. Measurements in heliometers ground-based (Rio) and onboard of balloons (SDS) and satellites (SOHO, SDO, HINODE) are compared. A didactic outreach with the giant pinhole telescope of Santa Maria degli Angeli Clementine Gnomon (1702) is shown.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: the Meridian line of Egnazio Danti in the Torre dei Venti in Vatican: an icone of Gregorian reformation of the Calendar

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The meridian line traced by Egnazio Danti in the Torre dei Venti in Vatican demostrated the need of the Gregorian Reformation of the Calendar. A review on this instrument is presented, along with the astrometric recognition. This meridian line, dated 1580, is deviated of 72 arcminutes Westward from the true North.
http://arxiv.org/abs/1401.3577

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Ipotesi astronomiche sul foro della colonna augustea di Santa Maria in Aracoeli
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: The tube carved in the column of Augustus in Santa Maria in Aracoeli

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The third column of the left row in the Basilica of Santa Maria in Aracoeli in Rome, has a hole carved in it, of probable astronomical use. The tube aims at a point a 116 degrees of azimut, East-South-East and 17.3 degrees of altitude, the Sun could be aimed in that direction at 07:00 UTC of 12 october and 7:25 UT of march 2, but the view is obstructed by the church's building. Same situation for the 3.9 magnitude alpha Monocerotis, visible 2000 years ago, taking into account the precession. Other hypotheses on the meridian astronomical use of this hole are here reviewed. In the case of solar observations it cannot be for meridian transits in Rome, since the lower transits occurs now at 24.5 degrees at winter solstice; we investigate the case of stellar transits, of declination 30.8 degrees South. Many alignments are possible leaving the azimut as free parameter, being the columun not in its original collocation, but here we investigate only the meridian transits, and no bright stars could have been seen through that hole, taking also into account the precession 2000 years ago. We conclude that this hole was probably not used for meridian observations.
http://arxiv.org/abs/1401.4747

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.LOCAL-DA-APRESENTACAO: Auditrio do 5 andar Centro Brasileiro de Pesquisas Fsicas Rua Dr. Xavier Sigaud, 150 - Urca

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: RESUMO: A variabilidade solar um assunto que tem evidncias em vrios campos, mesmo se o aquecimento global seja considerado antropognico. Mas tambm muito difcil estabelecer um modelo fsico das variaes. A forma do Sol foi discutida ao longo do sculo XX com um particular desenvolvimento de observaes e teoria. Vamos discutir a definio matemtica e fsica do limbo solar, e a influncia da atmosfera da Terra. Os mtodos de medida do dimetro do Sol incluem os trnsitos de Mercrio e Vnus, e os eclipses, e tambm as passagens meridianas e medidas com astrolbios. As experincias com resultados mais recentes so do Solar Disk Sextant, o satlite Picard e o Helimetro do Observatrio Nacional. Se apresentam e discutem os resultados.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: ABSTRACT: The solar variability is an issue that has evidence in various fields, even if the global warming is considered as anthropogenic. But it is also very difficult to establish a physical model of the variations. The solar figure was discussed throughout the twentieth century with a particular development of theory and observations. We will discuss the definition of mathematics and physics solar limb, and the influence of the Earth's atmosphere. The methods of measurement of the diameter of the Sun include transits of Mercury and Venus, and eclipses, and also passages at the meridian and measures with astrolabes. The latest experimental results are form the Solar Disk Sextant, the satellite Picard and Helimetro National Observatory are here discussed.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A fotometria, em particular a fotometria diferencial, das estrelas variveis pode ser uma atividade muito interessante pelos alunos das escolas.
H muitas estrelas variveis irregulares e os astrnomos profissionais no conseguem seguir todas as curvas de luz.
O exemplo mais claro Betelgeuse: no temos medidas com erro pequeno e no mesmo tempo de longo prazo. Raramente algum faz uma medida com uma preciso de 0.01 magnitudes. Esta coisa possvel fazendo fotometria diferencial.
Os ingredientes so: uma cmara CCD linear, o catalogo estelar VIZIER, um reloje, o software de analise das imagens por fotometria de apertura, conexo internet.
Os professores e os alunos podem enviar diariamente as observaes ao site aavso.org e contribuir na hora pesquisa nas estrelas variveis e podem fazer um relatrio final com poster onde apresentar suas observaes. O programa das observaes pode ser desenvolvido por todo o ano, com um gap de oito semanas, quando a estrela fica perto do Sol.
As estrelas que eu estudo so Betelgeuse e Delta do Escorpio, vou mostrar os resultados obtidos, mais nos somos bem longe da monitoragem continua.... Observadores colocados no Brasil so favorecidos da sua posio: o "Sacrobosco" (John Holywood) chamava ista condio de "esfera reta", onde as estrelas surgem e se pem (quase) verticalmente. Nessa forma a visibilidade das estrelas perto do Sol maior que nas regies temperadas.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The photometry, in particular the differential photometry, of Variable Stars can be a very interesting activity for school students.
There are many irregular variable stars and professional astronomers can not follow all the light curves.
The clearest example is Betelgeuse: we do not have long term accurate measures. Rarely someone makes a measurement with an accuracy of 0.01 magnitudes. This thing can be done with differential photometry.
The ingredients are: a linear CCD camera, the stellar catalog Vizier, a watch, the software to analyze the images for aperture photometry and internet connection.
Teachers and students can send data to the site aavso.org daily and contribute to the research on variable stars.
The program of observations can be developed throughout the year, with a gap of eight weeks, when the target star is close to the Sun
I bring examples of Betelgeuse and Delta Scorpii
Observers placed in Brazil are favorized their observing position because the star rise and set (almost) vertically. John Holywood in The Sphere (1256) defined this the condition of "Sphaera Recta". In this way the visibility of stars when near the Sun is longer than in the temperate regions, and the observational gap is reduced.

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.LOCAL-DA-APRESENTACAO: rua Dr. Xavier Sigaud, 150, Urca Auditorio 6. andar

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
O astrnomo, matemtico, filsofo, poltico, professor e monge beneditino Gerbert d'Aurillac foi uma personalidade eminente no sculo X. Seus interesses multidisciplinares, ainda pouco estudados e divulgados indicam, no entanto, um conhecimento que, em certa medida, pode nos ajudar a criar balizas para melhor compreender a nossa relao com o mundo contemporneo. Gerbert d'Aurillac , que teve seus escritos recolhidos juntamente com 232 cartas na Patrologia Latina, foi o primeiro a utilizar algarismos indo-arbicos na Europa crist, segundo consta, criados por ele mesmo e no de matriz rabe. Entre suas realizaes inventou um baco e um instrumento equatorial para observar o Sol, ajustado provavelmente pela medida do ano trpico. Estudou tambm a proporo dos tubos de rgo musical utilizando a base 12. Comparado a Leonardo da Vinci pela multiplicidade de realizaes em vrios campos, Gerbert d'Aurillac, que em 999 tornou-se o Papa Silvestre II, antecedeu o gnio italiano em 400 anos.
Para falar de Gerberto d'Aurillac e seu tempo, o Ciclo de Colquios do CBPF convidou o astrofsico italiano Costantino Sigismondi. Sigismondi, que tambm historiador da astronomia, tem como rea de trabalho a pesquisa sobre a medida do dimetro solar desenvolvida na Sapienza Universidade de Roma e no ICRANet, no Instituto de pesquisa solar em Locarno, Sua e na Universidade de Nice, Frana. Com esse interesse, atualmente Pesquisador Visitante do Observatrio Nacional com bolsa do CNPq.
Costantino Sigismondi tem ainda Licenciatura em Teologia e se ocupa da temtica "cincia e f". professor de Histria da Astronomia na Pontifcia Universidade Regina Apostolorum, em Roma, e membro, h quatro anos, do corpo editorial da revista acadmica GERBERTVS, com edies eletrnica (www.icra.it/gerbertus) e impressa, experincia sobre a qual tambm falar no colquio.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The astronomer, mathematician, philosopher, politician, teacher and Benedictine monk Gerbert d'Aurillac was an eminent figure of tenth century. His multidisciplinary interests, yet little studied and disseminated indicate, however, a knowledge which, to some extent, can help us to better understand our relationship with the contemporary world. Gerbert d'Aurillac, who had his writings collected together with 232 letters in Patrologia Latina, was the first to use Hindu-Arabic numerals in Christian Europe, reportedly created by himself and not from Arabs. Among his accomplishments invented an abacus and an equatorial instrument to observe the Sun, probably set by measuring the tropical year. Also he studied the ratio of the organ pipes using the musical base of number 12. Compared to Leonardo da Vinci for the multitude of achievements in various fields, Gerbert d'Aurillac, who in 999 became Pope Sylvester II, preceded the Italian genius of 400 years.
To speak of Gilberto d'Aurillac and his time, the cycle Colloquia CBPF invited astrophysicist Italian Costantino Sigismondi. Sigismondi, who is also a historian of astronomy, he is researching on the measurement of the solar diameter based at Sapienza University of Rome and ICRANet at the Institute of Solar Research in Locarno, Switzerland and at the University of Nice, France. With this interest, is currently a Visiting Researcher of the National Observatory with a scholarship from CNPq.
Costantino Sigismondi has even degree in Theology and is concerned with the theme "Science and Faith". He is Professor of History of Astronomy at the Pontifical Regina Apostolorum University in Rome and a member since four years, of the editorial board of the academic journal GERBERTVS with electronic editions (www.icra.it / gerbertus) and printed. On this experience he speaks at the conference.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A histria da ptica na Frana chegou a criar um neologismo "histoptique". Vamos ver a histria das lentes simples e dos espelhos na primeira fase da revoluo cientifica Os furos estenopeicos so as primeiras objectivas dos telescpios: podem ser considerados os pais das lentes e no tem aberraes cromticas nem esfricas. Depois de Paolo Toscanelli em Florena (1475) os furos estenopeicos foram utilizados por Kepler em Prague, Giandomenico Cassini em Bononia e Francesco Bianchini em Roma. Giuseppe Campani construiu em Roma as lentes para o Observatrio de Paris onde Cassini se transferiu. E Isaac Newton inventou o telescpio a reflexo em Cambridge. Na ptica matemtica do sculo 19 temos Joseph Petzval em Prague que estudou a geometria do campo de viso das lentes e dos espelhos. Chegamos at o Hliometro a reflexo do Observatrio Nacional do Rio de Janeiro: o ltimo instrumento observativo ainda operacional no Campus, que nos inspirou esta viagem na "histoptique".
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The history of optics in France even created a neologism "histoptique". Let's see the story of simple lenses and mirrors in the first phase of the scientific revolution. The pinholes are the first lenses of telescopes can be considered parents and the lens has no spherical or chromatic aberrations. After Paolo Toscanelli in Florence (1475) pinholes were used by Kepler in Prague, Giandomenico Cassini in Bononia and Francesco Bianchini in Rome. Giuseppe Campani lenses built in Rome to Paris Observatory where Cassini moved. And Isaac Newton invented the reflecting telescope in Cambridge. In 19th century mathematics we have Joseph Petzval who studied in Prague the geometry of the field of vision for lenses and mirrors. We arrived to the reflecting Heliometer of the National Observatory of Rio de Janeiro: the last instrument observational still operating on the campus, which inspired us this trip in "histoptique."

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
O Professor Costantino Sigismondi publicou artigos sobre Kepler e Tycho (The Observatory 121 380 2001) em sua relao com o uso de imagens estenopeicas para a medio do dimetro solar e a observao das manchas sem o telescpio de Galileu. Em 2002, ele publicou no American Journal of Physics (AJP 70, 1157 2002) a experincia de como fazer um helimetro atravs de dois furos, indicando tambm as frmulas para obter a melhor resoluo angular dessas imagens. A realizao de tais experincias ocorreram em escolas e instituies de Nova York (Trinity College), em Roma, Bukowiec [vejam http://www.millsky.home.pl/obserwatorium/?p=1169 ] e Lodz (Polonia) e Rio de Janeiro, onde os mesmos alunos tm construdo e operado suos "telescpios" com furos estenopeicos, em meia hora.
O uso de distncias focais longas, maiores de 50 m, com dimetros de furos menores de 1 cm, foi bem sucedida no fornecimento de alta resoluo angular nestas imagens. O mesmo nmero de manchas visveis com um telescpio so visveis na cmara escura, onde a imagem estenopeica projetada. A coerncia angular dentro de 30 segundos de arco da luz que entra na rea da tela permite de repeter com grande sucesso tambm a experincia de Francesco Maria Grimaldi (1618-1663), que mostra a difrao da luz por um obstculo que posto entre o furo ea tela. Adicionando um filtro colorido em frente do furo, de modo a seleccionar os comprimentos de onda, as franjas de Fresnel em todo o perfil do obstculo podem ser observadas muito claramente. O experimento bem simples, s preciso encontrar no instituto um corredor suficientemente longo que serve como uma cmara escura em que para projetar a luz do Sol atravs de um espelho plano e um buraco circular com, eventualmente, um filtro colorido. Se o espelho estiver fixo a um trip fotogrfico equipada com botes de controle o movimento deste mais fcil. Este sistema tem a funo de um celstato. Os estudantes podem colaborar

400 anos atrs, com o telescpio e 1000 anos atrs com tubos: Galileu eo papa Silvestre II, observando o So l Costantino Sigismondi (Observatorio Nacional do Rio de Janeiro, Brasil)
Os alunos que frequentam sero convidados a ter observaes seguras do Sol com os seus prprios istruments e com o telescpio do Observatrio. Vou deix-los com segurana observar o Sol com sombras, tubos, orifcios, espelhos, binculos ... medio em uma semana do movimento de algumas manchas que mostram a rotao do Sol, como Galileo primeiro feito em 1613.
De 13 de Maio a 16 de 2013.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
400 years ago with the telescope and 1000 years ago with tubes: Galileo and pope Sylvester II observing the Sun Costantino Sigismondi (Observatorio Nacional of Rio de Janeiro, Brasil)
The attending students will be invited to have safe observations of the Sun with their own istruments and with the telescope of the Observatory. I will let them observe safely the Sun with shadows, tubes, pinholes, mirrors, binoculars... measuring in a week the motion of some spots showing the rotation of the Sun, as Galileo first made in 1613.
From May 13 to 16 2013.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The spin-orbital exchange of energy is possible when there are tides. The case of the Earth, thanks to the lunar action is linear and it has been studied and measured since before the telescope era. The case of Venus is chaotic as recently evidenced by J. Laskar. The presentation will be done in the Basilica of Santa Maria degli Angeli e dei Martiri, built by Michelangelo on the ancient vaulted aula of the Thermae of Diocletian, where Francesco Bianchini draft the 50 m meridian line with pinhole designed to measure the obliquity and the tropical year's duration from 1700 to 2500: the first big and long-living science project ever made up to the modern European Extremely Large Telescope. Bianchini published in 1728 also the first accurate observation of Venus clouds, made in Rome's Palatine hill with a long focus and single-lens telescope.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The spin-orbital exchange of energy is possible when there are tides. The case of the Earth, thanks to the lunar action is linear and it has been studied and measured since before the telescope era. The case of Venus is chaotic as recently evidenced by J. Laskar. AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Astronomia de Posio e Mecnica Celeste

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The figure of the Sun has been investigated to assess the quadrupole moment of the Sun and its influence on the Mercury s perihelion precession. It has been carefully studied observationally from R.H.Dicke and collaborators in Princeton in a framework of possible modified theories of General Relativity since the late 60s. J.P.Rozelot and collaborators continued the studies at Pic du Midi Observatory aiming to uncover the internal structure of the Sun. Nowadays the interest of these studies covers also space and Earth climate issues, with the micro-variations of the solar diameter related to corresponding variations of the irradiance, and to coronal mass ejections. The Heliometer operating at the Observatorio Nacional in Rio de Janeiro has been conceived to obtain the measurement of the solar diameter at all heliolatitudes with an accuracy of one part over 100000. The first results (2010-2013) are discussed along with the data from the solar Astrolabe which observed from Rio during the period 1998-2009, covering a whole solar cycle. Finally the diameters coming from the observations of the transits of Venus in 2012 (China) and 2004 (Athens) are presented.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The figure of the Sun has been investigated to assess the quadrupole moment of the Sun and its influence on the Mercury s perihelion precession. It has been carefully studied observationally from R.H.Dicke and collaborators in Princeton in a framework of possible modified theories of General Relativity since the late 60s. J.P.Rozelot and collaborators continued the studies at Pic du Midi Observatory aiming to uncover the internal structure of the Sun. Nowadays the interest of these studies covers also space and Earth climate issues, with the micro-variations of the solar diameter related to corresponding variations of the irradiance, and to coronal mass ejections. The Heliometer operating at the Observatorio Nacional in Rio de Janeiro has been conceived to obtain the measurement of the solar diameter at all heliolatitudes with an accuracy of one part over 100000. The first results (2010-2013) are discussed along with the data from the solar Astrolabe which observed from Rio during the period 1998-2009, covering a whole solar cycle. Finally the diameters coming from the observations of the transits of Venus in 2012 (China) and 2004 (Athens) are presented.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: reas Clssicas de Fenomenologia e suas Aplicaes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The observation of the Sun with pinholes was started in Florence's Cathedral in 1475, and in Ulugh Beg observatory in Samarcand in 1424-29, well before the invention of the telescope, for measuring the solar position and the variation of the obliquity of the Earth's axis. Later, with Kepler, pinholes' telescopes were used to follow the solar spots when the telescopes made by Galileo were not available. The use of pinholes in positional solar astrometry continued successfully up to 1800 in some great Italian and French Churches. Nowadays by using pinholes it is possible to show the principles of positional astronomy and imaging to students with instruments very easy to be built at almost no cost. The concepts of focal length, best focus, angular resolution, atmospheric seeing and atmospheric transmittance can be verified with such simple devices. Such pinhole telescopes have been built by primary-school students at the Astronomical Observatory dedicated to the Pope astronomer Sylvester II, located in Bukowiec, Poland, which is at its third year of activity. The largest solar spots have been observed clearly with these instruments, demonstrating the principles discussed in this presentation. The light cast by one of this devices with 70 m of focal length and 1 cm of diameter has permitted also to repeat succesfully the experiences on the diffraction of the light, made in 1648 by the Jesuits Riccioli and Grimaldi. By selecting the wavelengths with a coloured Kodak orange filter the effect of alternance of light and shadows of Fresnel fringes was clearly visible at the edge of the shadow of an object posed at 15 m from the screen. The experience made at the Primary school of Bukowiec and repeated at the Museu de Astronomia in Rio de Janeiro, the largest institution for education, divulgation and popularization of astronomy in Brazil, has obtained very positive replies.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Solar observations due to more acceptable hours are important in outreach. There is also value in reporting observation of the Sun even with simple instruments. They also serve as a practical illustration to history of astronomy. We present our work regarding solar observations at Pope Sylvester II's Astronomical Observatory in Bukowiec (among others, solar workshops - during which we observed the Sun with the same method as Kepler - and managed to construct possibly the biggest camera obscura in the world, and the annual picnic, where we demonstrated to the public not only sunspots, but also prominences, spicules and filaments).

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: reas Clssicas de Fenomenologia e suas Aplicaes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Sun, our star, is our main source of energy. The Sun influences the seasons, the life of humans, animals, germination of plants and seeds dormancy ... everything on Earth depends on the Sun. It has been shown that the irradiance of the Sun, or rather its variations on time scales of tens of years, affects the Earth's climate. All weather anomalies that occur during these years, such as the desertification of entire regions or the actual transformation of the Mediterranean into a tropical bioma, are the consequence of solar activity. The Sun, sequentially or randomly modifies its physical size by altering the level of radiation accordingly sent on Earth. Up to now there is no conclusive predictive model of the solar behavior, by which to study and predict the oscillations of the whole solar figure and consequently the resulting radiative rate. This is mainly due to the inability to make accurate and continuous measurements on the size of the Sun and ofits fluctuations. The current measure of the Sun with high precision are carried either from satellites or balloons, in order to eliminate the atmospheric turbulence. Though very precise, these are major limitations related to the costs and the limited lifetime. The project ELISTAR Eliometria alla Sapienza con Tecnologia ad Altissima Risoluzione aims to build and install a new system for ground-based observations of the solar figure. This instrument will upgrade the one already realized in the National Observatory in Rio de Janeiro: it is extremely compact, low-cost, highly accurate, easy to use and allows future implementations. ELISTAR monitor continuously the Sun and its size, by means of a differential technique to increase the accuracy. The image processing software will also include a code of compensation of the deformations of the image for atmospheric refraction and turbulence.

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Congresso Europeo dei Professori Universitari
DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.LOCAL-DA-APRESENTACAO: Basilica di Santa Maria degli Angeli e dei Martiri

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The spin-orbital exchange of energy is possible when there are tides. The case of the Earth, thanks to the lunar action is linear and it has been studied and measured since before the telescope era. The case of Venus is chaotic as recently evidenced by J. Laskar. The presentation will be done in the Basilica of Santa Maria degli Angeli e dei Martiri, built by Michelangelo on the ancient vaulted aula of the Thermae of Diocletian, where Francesco Bianchini draft the 50 m meridian line with pinhole designed to measure the obliquity and the tropical year's duration from 1700 to 2500: the first big and long-living science project ever made. Bianchini published in 1728 also the first accurate observation of Venus clouds, made in Rome's Palatine hill with a long focus and single-lens telescope.

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: III Congresso sui Due Veli: la Sindone e la Tilma di Guadalupe

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: On the spur of Calvary the Shroud appears. On this rock the Scriptures are fulfilled, and this rock, located exactly to the West of the Temple of Jerusalem, becomes mystically the new orient, place of the Resurrection of the Lord. The alignements between the three holy places for the three monotheistic religions, the Anastasis, the Temple, now Dome of the Rock, and the Chapel of the Ascension with the East-West axis are here measured and commented both from an astronomical and topographic point of view, enlighted by the urbanistic roman concepts of Vitruvius and the catechesis of saint Cyril bishop of Jerusalem 13 years after the inauguration of the Constantinian buildings at the Holy Sepulcre.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The solar eclipse of Good Friday has always been recognized as a problem from the astronomical point of view. The date of Crucifixion has been investigated by many scholars and the most accredited one is friday 3 april 33, when, at sunset an eclipsed Moon rised. Few minutes later the apparition of a third star of medium magnitude stated the beginning of the sabbatical rest: before that time Jesus has been buried, wrapped into the shroud. All these topics are reviewed from an astronomical point of view with some theological considerations.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: reas Clssicas de Fenomenologia e suas Aplicaes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The Basilica of St. Maria degli Angeli is right in front of Termini Station in Rome, very easy to be visited. Made by Michelangelo with the walls and the vaulted aula of Diocletian's Bath it contains two astronomical instruments: the Divinity in Light dome - Lucernaria (2000) http://arxiv.org/abs/1112.0401 and the Clementine Gnomon (1702) http://arxiv.org/abs/1202.1071 and http://arxiv.org/abs/1106.2976 .
The measurement of the solar diameter exploiting the drift-scan method can be performed at the Lucernaria, using a paper with evenly spaced parallel lines on it. This experience is possibile because the solar images produced in Lucernaria are obtained with sinlge lenses, that act as solar telescopes in a give waveband (yellow, orange and red from winter to summer time).
At home IOTA observers can use a simple telescope to project the solar image on a screen and repeat the experiment. 30 fps, and more can be used to monitor the solar diameter. The limiting resolution is given by the atmospheric seeing, but many measurements can be averaged to obtain a more representative value.
About the latest news on the solar diameter studies I presented the discovery of the prsimatic effect of some glass filters used in the solar astrolabes (Rio, Calern, San Fernando, Santiago de Chile, Antalya, Sao Paulo) which made their results different one from another Now we know the reason thanks to a similar effect detected in the Thousands Oaks glass 2D solar filter of the Heliometer of Rio de Janeiro http://arxiv.org/abs/1306.3204 .
I recalled that IOTA observers contributed to the unification of the definition of solar diameter in heliometric observations (inflexion point of the Limb Darkening Function) and in the eclipse Baily's beads http://arxiv.org/abs/1201.0707 , thanks to the almost 600 beads published in the Atlas 2005-2008 on Solar Physics.
Finally I recommend to do also experiences with 60 fps camcorder and more, using far towerbells for simulati

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: L'osservatorio scomparso del Campidoglio (17.9.13)
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: The disappeared observatory of Capitol

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Upter Gratis

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Viene presentato un osservatorio che non c' pi, e che quindi non si puo' visitare se non col ricordo: fu raso al suolo dallo zelo purista degli anni 30 del novecento, che ha fatto vittime illustri in diverse chiese del centro storico con l'eliminazione degli interventi barocchi... L'osservatorio astronomico del Campidoglio aveva completato 108 anni di onorato servizio dal 1829. Tra le attivit in corso al momento del suo smantellamento c'era la misura del diametro solare da transiti meridiani, sotto la direzione di Giuseppe Armellini, poi passato a dirigere l'osservatorio di Monte Mario. Solo Greenwich poteva vantare una serie di dati pi lunga del Campidoglio, e fino ad oggi i dati capitolini hanno fatto testo in astrometria solare. Scopriremo la storia di questo osservatorio, dove si trovava, cosa si faceva e quali risonanze questi lavori hanno avuto nel mondo scientifico di allora e di oggi.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The observtory of Capitol in Rome was dismantled in 1937. Up to then a series of measurements of the solar diameters was continuously made since 1877. Its history of this observatory, belonging to Sapienza University of Rome since the foundation made by the pope Leo XII his drafted.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: 2013 Fall Equinox and Meridians anniversary

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Equinozio di Autnno
DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: Basilica di Santa Maria degli Angeli e dei Martiri

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Quest'anno sia l'equinozio di autunno, il 22 settembre, che il compleanno della meridiana, il 6 ottobre, capitano di domenica. Il passaggio del Sole sulla linea meridiana avverr al termine della messa di mezzogiorno, alle 13:02 del 22 settembre, sulle ellissi equinoziali, e alle 12:58 del 6 ottobre, sul nuovo passaggio in vetro che ne consente l'osservazione. Nelle due circostanze la Basilica offre un intrattenimento musicale post-missam per accompagnare l'incedere dell'immagine solare sul pavimento della chiesa fino al transito meridiano, all'organo di Bartolom Formentelli del 2000, il pi grande organo che c' a Roma.
Il 6 ottobre, altra domenica, sar il 311 compleanno della meridiana. Era lo strumento pi avanzato della sua epoca per l'astrometria solare: fu inaugurato e voluto da papa Clemente XI a soli 70 anni dalla conclusione del caso Galileo, proprio nel giorno anniversario della sua prima messa e nella ricorrenza di san Bruno, fondatore dei monaci Certosini che tennero questa Basilica fino al 1887
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: On September 22, 2013 the fall equinox is observed at the meridian line of Santa Maria degli Angeli in Rome, as well as the transit of the Sun on october 6, anniversary day of its inauguration in 1702 by the pope Clement XI. An organ music concert accompanies the astronomical event.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dbXjbskBMQfUJyFrzOIeVFUXFthJuBLJTH4MObULtU0/edit
Sapienza Facolt di Lettere Aula Odion e Cappella della Divina Sapienza Settiamana delle scienze umanistiche luned 11 marzo 2013 h. 14:30 - 20
Tradizionalmente per umanesimo intendiamo una svolta culturale del 400 quando l uomo diventa il centro di gravita del suo agire e del suo pensare, come nell uomo vitruviano di Leonardo, centro del cosmo. Ma qual era il posto dell uomo all alba del secondo millennio? Era davvero tanto periferico, soggetto alla superstizione di cui la religione era connivente garante? No: azione di carit intellettuale mostrare la visione gi potente dell uomo medievale attraverso la figura di Gerberto d Aurillac-Silvestro il papa scienziato dell anno mille, che visse una sintesi tra scienza e fede ancora oggi attuale. Tre secoli dopo abbiamo la figura di Dante che mostra come l uomo possa trascorrer l infinita via che tiene una Sustanzia in Tre Persone, secondo l Itinerarium di San Bonaventura, arrivando alla pienezza della sua essenza. Dopo la rivoluzione scientifica dei secoli XVI e XVII, l asse del pensiero umano si sposta sul soggetto con Descartes e con Pascal conoscendo un ulteriore sviluppo del concetto di umanesimo, che culminer nel secolo dei lumi e nel positivismo degli ultimi tre secoli. La cultura dominante cerca di proporre un modello sempre pi affrancato da Dio Creatore. Di fronte a questa deriva a cui la cultura contemporanea si trova davanti dopo le rivoluzioni industriale e della globalizzazione che hanno trasformato lhomo faber in homo faciendum, la Chiesa propone una nuova evangelizzazione per il terzo millennio, attenta alle esigenze del momento. Ripercorriamo queste tappe dello sviluppo del concetto di umanesimo nel secondo millennio dell era cristiana per comprendere meglio il senso di un nuovo umanesimo per il terzo millennio. Svilupperemo il concetto con 6 temi satellite ordinati diacronicamente, con la musica ad ac
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: From Gerbert to Dante, through Kepler and Galileo we arrive to deal with the digital humanities, in order to focus the new evangelization strategies.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WNvLCOXoNdLMnaIoz1XN-d-vN-sswR_yIo4FmQeXCys/edit
Gerberto d Aurillac (938 ca.-1003), dal 999 papa Silvestro II, lo ricordiamo in occasione del 12 maggio, giorno della sua morte. La sua figura poliedrica ne fece il pi grande docente del X secolo, ed il suo impulso sulla cultura europea spazia dalla musica (teoria delle canne d organo) all aritmetica (introduzione in Europa dei numeri indo arabici) alla geometria (un trattato), all astronomia (introduzione dell astrolabio) alla logica (un trattato) e molto altro. Da Papa apr la Chiesa a Polonia ed Ungheria ed estese da Cluny a tutta la Chiesa la Commemorazione dei defunti il 2 novembre. La sua venerata memoria stata ricordata da Papa Benedetto XVI nell'Angelus del 21.12.2008 all'apertura dell'anno internazionale dell'astronomia quando il solstizio coincise con la domenica.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Gerbert of Aurillac, scientist benedictin monk and finally pope Sylvester II (999-1003) was the most remarkable personality of his times. For his importance in the history of science he is studied by many specialists of all disciplines including astronomy, mathematics, music, philosophy and history.

Estrela Nova brilhante no cu da madrugada: oportunidade nica para ver um espetaculo bem raro

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Uma estrela nova apareceu na Constelao do Centauro no dia 2 de dezembro e hoje vai chegar ao maximo da sua luminosidade D para ver tambm a olho nu, bem perto da estrela Beta do Centauro, debaixo do Cruzeiro do Sul.
O Professor Costantino Sigismondi, Pesquisador Visitante ao Observatrio Nacional e ao Centro Brasileiro de Pesquisa Fisica do Rio de Janeiro est acompanhando e medindo este evento. " um evento muito raro com esta luminosidade, o mais brilhante dos ltimos 10 anos e bem fcil a localizar" Uma grande exploso acontece na estrela que por isso ficou nova: " uma gigantesca bomba atmica que explode nas camdas superficiais duma estrela nana branca. A oportunidade de acompanhar este evento antes que chegue ao mximo bem raro e at hoje somente treze pessoas no inteiro emispherio Sul observaram o fenomeno, por falta de informao. 13 so bem poucas em toda Australia, Africa do Sul e America do Sul! Todos os cariocas poderiam aproveitar deste fenomeno virando-se astronomos por algumas noites e aumentando a partecipao dos Brasileiros a este espetaculo"
O pesquisador recommenda de usar um binoculo para uma melhor viso desde a cidade do Rio, tam cheia de luzes de noite. Encontrar lugares com o horizonte Sul livre (as praias da zona Sul so perfeitas) e olhar desde 3h30 at 5h da madrugada dos prximos dias. Nas otras horas a estrela no visivel. Um mapa em anexo ajuda a encotrar esta estrela: os pontinhos mais grandes so as estrelas mais brilhantes e a Nova est no lugar do quadrado, e est um pouco mais fraca das maiores estrelas vizinhas. Nos prximos dias ela vai enfraquecer at disparecer, mostrando que o cu sempre cheio de novidades.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: About the appartition and the observation of the Nova Centauri 2013, near its brilliant maximum. The brightest nova of the last 10 years.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Subjects: Optical, Pulsar
During the recent flaring up of the Crab pulsar detected by Fermi, AGILE and Integral (ATel #4855, #4856 and #4869), we were observing the pulsar with Aqueye mounted at the 182cm Copernico telescope at Asiago Cima-Ekar (for a short description of the instrument and results from previous observations see Germana` et al. 2013, A&A, 548, id. A47). The observations were taken as part of the program of the Asiago Winter School on Very High Time and Space Resolution Astrophysics (http://www.astro.unipd.it/~ws2013/). Good data were obtained the nights of 2, 3, 4 March, according to the log in Table 1.
Table 1
White light Date - Start time (UTC) - Stop time (UTC) 2013 03 02 - 22:18:38 - 22:40:14 2013 03 02 - 22:45:59 - 23:04:53 2013 03 03 - 21:26:10 - 21:48:56 2013 03 03 - 21:53:07 - 22:17:18 2013 03 03 - 22:22:29 - 22:43:48 2013 03 04 - 18:31:43 - 19:31:46
Simultaneous BVR photometry Date - Start time (UTC) - Stop time (UTC) 2013 03 04 - 19:43:01 - 22:29:39
We performed a preliminary analysis of the light curve with a time resolution of 33.6 microseconds and found no significant variation of the pulse shape during the occurrence of the flare. Although undetected in this preliminary analysis, we cannot yet definitely exclude the presence of glitches. The fractional rms of the light curve (binned at 3 millisecond and including sky and nebular background) is 12%-13% and did not display pronounced variations during the three observing nights. A more refined discussion must await the barycenterization procedure, which will take some more time.
